Topic: First Amendment: Religious Freedom

Permission Required Prior to Enrollment. To request permission to register, contact Prof. María M. Carrión - mcarrio@emory.edu
The prerequisite for this course will be waived.
Law school schedule: Tuesday and Thursday 12:00 pm-1:30 pm
Religious liberty is one of the hallmarks of modern constitutional democracies, though it has come under considerable attack in recent years. This course analyzes the historical formation and current interpretation of the religious liberty guarantees of the First Amendment to the United States Constitution.
course_description: Through variables such as arts, politics, freedom, race, nd coloniality, this repeatable special topics course will explore various ways in which religion and law intersect and pose questions in political life, social justice struggles, community conversations and spaces, and cultural consciousness.
